intro: Phlegmariurus attenuatus, commonly known as the slender thornmoss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its creeping growth habit and the presence of small, elongated leaves that are often slightly curled. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as on tree trunks or in rocky crevices. Its reproductive structures, known as archegonia, are located on the underside of the leaves. This moss is widely distributed across temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere.
